title: Installation issue: LLVM fails on MacOS with clang and microarchitecture flags
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

Ensure that the clang compiler is **not** a mixed toolchain in compilers.yaml:

```yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    spec: apple-clang@12.0.0
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/clang
      cxx: /usr/bin/clang++
      f77: null
      fc: null
    operating_system: catalina
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
```
```console
$ spack install llvm
...
  >> 3736    clang: error: the clang compiler does not support '-march=skylake'
  >> 3737    make[2]: *** [projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/CMakeFiles/clang_r
             t.builtins_arm64_osx.dir/comparetf2.c.o] Error 1
```
Make the clang compiler a mixed toolchain (in my case, I build gcc and copy the f77 & fc lines)
```console
$ spack install llvm
==> No binary for llvm-11.1.0-capkkllvmkkcl3wkyviaegdqxwxw5xfq found: installing from source
==> Warning: Missing a source id for apple-libuuid@1353.100.2
==> Warning: microarchitecture specific optimizations are not supported yet on mixed compiler toolchains [check apple-clang@12.0.0 for further details]
...
```
Success
### Information on your system
macOS catalina, 10.15.7

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-2323-a568903a64
* **Python:** 3.7.9
* **Platform:** darwin-catalina-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
